data.title: NASA has completed the $8.7 billion James Webb space telescope - Hubble's successor is ready for testing ahead of the October, 2018 launch - It's equipped with a 21-foot, gold-coated mirror array that can collect seven times more light than Hubble and scan the infrared spectrum to see through dust.
Indian rupee ₹500 and ₹1000 abolished from midnight by India
Brexit campaign may be prosecuted for lying to voters.

More than 1,000 Hong Kong lawyers dressed in black marched through the heart of the city in silence on Tuesday to condemn a move by China that effectively bars two elected pro-independence lawmakers from taking their seats in the legislature
Spyware routinely installed by UK schools to snoop on childrens web habits
Tory MPs fillerbust until law to pay interns the minimum wage runs out of time
BBC News: Scottish government to intervene in Brexit case
Massive Lake Found Under Bolivian Volcano - "The subterranean lake apparently contains a volume of water that's somewhere between Lake Huron (850 cubic miles) and Lake Superior (2,903 cubic miles)"
London police guilty of 'serious failings' over VIP child sex cases
Elon Musk calls for universal income after robots take human jobs: 'People will have time to do other things, more complex things, more interesting things'
Sweden now allowing US Homeland Security officers at Stockholm airport, permanently and with access to own weapons
Earth Just Experienced the Hottest Five Years on Record

Harvard scientists think they've pinpointed the physical source of consciousness - "Scientists have struggled for millennia to understand human consciousness - the awareness of one's existence. Despite advances in neuroscience, we still don't really know where it comes from, and how it arises."
Saudi rapists who attacked woman in front of her daughter sentenced to thousands of lashes and lengthy prison terms
Iranian media says authorities have blinded a man to punish him for throwing chemicals in the face of a four-year-old girl in a 2009 assault that destroyed her vision.
